SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

Class DefaultHTTPRequestHandler

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.DefaultHTTPRequestHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
HTTPRequestHandler
public class DefaultHTTPRequestHandler extends Object implements HTTPRequestHandler
Default implementation of HTTPRequestHandler with empty methods.

Extend this class to implement only the methods you need, rather than having to implement all methods of the interface.

Example


 public class HelloHandler extends DefaultHTTPRequestHandler {
     
     @Override
     public void headers(Headers headers, HTTPResponseState state) {
         if ("GET".equals(headers.getMethod())) {
             Headers response = new Headers();
             response.status(HTTPStatus.OK);
             response.add("content-type", "text/plain");
             state.headers(response);
             state.startResponseBody();
             state.responseBodyContent(ByteBuffer.wrap("Hello, World!".getBytes()));
             state.endResponseBody();
             state.complete();
         }
     }
 }
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • headers

      public void headers(Headers headers, HTTPResponseState state)
      Description copied from interface: HTTPRequestHandler
      Headers received.

      Called when HTTP headers are received. This may be called multiple times for the same request:

      • Initial request headers (always includes :method, :path, :scheme, :authority pseudo-headers regardless of HTTP version)
      • Continuation headers (if header block spans multiple frames)
      • Trailer headers (after HTTPRequestHandler.endRequestBody(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState))

      The position in the event sequence indicates the header type: headers before startRequestBody() are request headers; headers after endRequestBody() are trailers.

      Specified by:
      headers in interface HTTPRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      headers - the headers (pseudo-headers normalized for all HTTP versions)
      state - the response state for sending the response

    • startRequestBody

      public void startRequestBody(HTTPResponseState state)
      Description copied from interface: HTTPRequestHandler
      Request body is starting.

      Called before the first HTTPRequestHandler.requestBodyContent(java.nio.ByteBuffer, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState) if the request has a body. Not called for requests without a body (GET, HEAD, etc.).

      Specified by:
      startRequestBody in interface HTTPRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      state - the response state

    • requestBodyContent

      public void requestBodyContent(ByteBuffer data, HTTPResponseState state)
      Description copied from interface: HTTPRequestHandler
      Request body data received.

      Called for each chunk of request body data. May be called multiple times. The buffer is only valid during this callback - if the data is needed later, it must be copied.

      Specified by:
      requestBodyContent in interface HTTPRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      data - the body data (position and limit define valid range)
      state - the response state

    • endRequestBody

      public void endRequestBody(HTTPResponseState state)
      Description copied from interface: HTTPRequestHandler
      Request body complete.

      Called after the last HTTPRequestHandler.requestBodyContent(java.nio.ByteBuffer, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState) when all body data has been received. Trailer headers (if any) will follow via HTTPRequestHandler.headers(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.Headers, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState) before HTTPRequestHandler.requestComplete(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState).

      Specified by:
      endRequestBody in interface HTTPRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      state - the response state

    • requestComplete

      public void requestComplete(HTTPResponseState state)
      Description copied from interface: HTTPRequestHandler
      Request stream closed from client side.

      This is the final callback for this stream. No more events will be delivered. The handler should complete its response if not already done.

      Specified by:
      requestComplete in interface HTTPRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      state - the response state
